Summary: Add AgentPassport.v1 protocol object and schema
Description: Formalize principal-backed agent identity envelope with delegation root, key anchors, and policy envelope hints.
Acceptance Criteria: Spec + schema merged; examples validate; object hash/signing rules documented with strict null/optional semantics.

Description: Resolve effective authority from root->leaf grants with depth, expiry, and revocation checks.
Acceptance Criteria: Deterministic lineage resolution for same snapshot; explicit failure codes for revoked/expired/depth violations.

Summary: Bind delegation refs into decision/receipt artifacts
Description: Persist delegation root/effective grant refs so historical accountability survives runtime drift.
Acceptance Criteria: Decision + receipt bindings include stable delegation refs and pass offline verification replay.

Summary: Add ExecutionIntent.v1 protocol object and schema
Description: Create canonical pre-execution intent with request fingerprint, risk profile, spend bounds, and policy binding.
Acceptance Criteria: Spec + schema merged; intent hash rules are deterministic and test vectors exist for canonicalization edge cases.

Summary: Implement policy compiler and deterministic decision hash
Description: Compile policy packs into executable constraints and emit deterministic decision fingerprints.
Acceptance Criteria: Identical policy+intent input emits byte-equivalent decision records and stable evaluation hashes.

Summary: Gate authorize-payment on issuer decision for all wallet-bound flows
Description: Enforce issuer as sole mint authority and reject bypass paths.
Acceptance Criteria: All wallet-bound authorize paths fail without valid decision token; replay semantics remain idempotent.

Description: Standardize obligations, milestones, settlement terms, and dispute venue for agent work contracts.
Acceptance Criteria: Work contract schema supports milestone payment and dispute linkage without ambiguous state transitions.

Description: Add append-only milestone transitions with deterministic settle/reverse semantics.
Acceptance Criteria: Milestone transitions are replay-safe; duplicate submissions do not double-settle.

Summary: Require strict request binding for side-effect contracts
Description: Enforce request fingerprint matching for action/financial class contract calls.
Acceptance Criteria: Mutated request replay is rejected with stable code; read/compute backward compatibility remains intact.

Description: Add policy-aware `resolve` API for tool/provider selection by intent, budget, and risk constraints.
Acceptance Criteria: Resolver excludes uncertified/incompatible options by default and returns deterministic ranked results.

Description: Allow agent runtimes to call Nooterra resolver directly through MCP surfaces.
Acceptance Criteria: MCP tool returns machine-usable ranked options with trust bindings and policy compatibility flags.

Summary: Implement negotiation thread protocol and API
Description: Add offer/counter/accept/abort deterministic thread state machine.
Acceptance Criteria: Thread replay reproduces final state exactly; invalid transitions return stable reject codes.

Summary: Compute reputation deltas from verified outcomes only
Description: Build reputation pipeline from receipt/outcome proofs; exclude unverifiable signals.
Acceptance Criteria: All reputation events contain source receipt ids; no mutation occurs without verifiable evidence chain.

Description: Issue bounded credit lines based on policy + verified reliability metrics.
Acceptance Criteria: Credit decisions are reproducible and include machine-readable rationale bindings to input evidence snapshots.

Description: Add claim intake/decision path bound to outcome and contract evidence.
Acceptance Criteria: Claim decisions are append-only, explainable, and bound to contract+receipt references.

Summary: Define compliance decision protocol and policy packs
Description: Add jurisdiction-aware compliance decision object and policy pack schema.
Acceptance Criteria: Compliance decisions are deterministic, exportable, and include rule-level explainability fields.

Description: Add pluggable oracle adapter with quorum policy for real-world completion signals.
Acceptance Criteria: Oracle disagreement follows deterministic quorum/fail-closed outcomes and is receipt-event traceable.

Summary: Add physical rail adapters as certified tool contracts
Description: Model payout/procurement/card flows as certified provider adapters instead of bespoke runtime paths.
Acceptance Criteria: Each adapter passes conformance and produces standard receipt/decision/reversal evidence with no privileged bypass channels.
